info.title: API Reference for Tableau Resource Versioned RESTful Endpoints
info.description:
>The following OpenAPI documentation describes the details of the new Tableau RESTful APIs. A growing number of these are  being released alongside more than 150 [classic REST endpoints](https://help.tableau.com/current/api/rest_api/en-us/REST/rest_api_ref.htm)  that are currently in wide usage in the Tableau community. 

 >There are some differences users of the classic endpoints will recognize when viewing these new endpoints. Request bodies for these new REST endpoints must  be formatted using JSON. Endpoint URIs don't contain an API version number. For more information, see  [REST API and Resource Versions](https://help.tableau.com/current/api/rest_api/en-us/REST/rest_api_concepts_versions.htm).

tags.name: Analytics Extensions Settings Methods
tags.description:
Enable and configure [analytics extensions](https://help.tableau.com/current/server/en-us/config_r_tabpy.htm) on sites and, for on premise installations, on servers. With these extensions you can extend Tableau dynamic calculations with languages like R and python, and with other tools and platforms. For more information, see [Analytics Extensions API](https://tableau.github.io/analytics-extensions-api/). When upgrading from a server version less than 2020.2, analytics extensions must be enabled on each site even if external services were enabled on the server being upgraded. Connections for sites must be ported manually. Using the analytics extensions settings methods you can:
  • Enable and disable analytics extensions for a Tableau server (on-premise only) or for a site.
  • Create and manage an extension's connections to the service hosting your custom calculations.

tags.name: Dashboard Extensions Settings Methods
tags.description:
Enable and configure security for [dashboard extensions](https://help.tableau.com/current/server/en-us/config_r_tabpy.htm) on sites and, for on premise installations, on servers. With these extensions you can add custom features to a dashboard using JavaScript. Using the extension methods of the Tableau Server REST API you can:
  • List the settings for extensions of a server or site
  • Enable or disable extensions or sandboxed extensions for a server or site
  • List, get, create, and delete entries in server blocked extensions list
  • List, get, create, update, and delete entries in server allowed (safe) extensions list
This functionality relates to the UI elements and concepts described at [Manage Dashboard Settings](https://help.tableau.com/current/server/en-us/dashboard_extensions_server.htm).

get.description: Get the details of a specified analytics extension connection to an external service. Permissions - This method can only be called by users with server or site administrator permissions.

put.summary: Update analytics extension connection of site
put.description: Updates the details of specified analytics extension connection for an external service to a site. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

delete.summary: Delete analytics extension connection from site
delete.description: Deletes a specific analytics extension connection for an external service from a site. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

get.summary: Get allowed dashboard extension on site
get.description: Gets the details of a specific dashboard extension on the safe list of the site you are signed into. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

put.summary: Update settings for allowed dashboard extension on site
put.description: Updates the settings of a specific dashboard extension in the safe list of the site you are signed into. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

delete.description: Deletes a specific dashboard extension from the safe list of the site you are signed into. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

get.summary: List analytics extension connections of workbook
get.description: Lists basic details of each analytics extension connection available for a specified workbook, including connection type and name. Permissions - This method can be called by users that have permissions to the specified workbook.

get.summary: Get current analytics extension for workbook
get.description: Gets basic details, including connection type and name, of the analytics extension connection to an external service that the specified workbook is currently using. Permissions - This method can be called by users with authoring access to the workbook.

put.description: Updates the analytics extension connection to external service currently used by a workbook. Permissions - This method can be called by users that have permissions to the specified workbook.

delete.summary: Remove current analytics extension connection for workbook
delete.description: Remove the currently used analytics extension connection to an external service  from the specified workbook. The connection remains configured, and is available for further usage by the workbook. Permissions - This method can be called by users with authoring access to the workbook.

get.summary: Get enabled state of analytics extensions on site
get.description: Gets the enabled/disabled state of analytics extensions on a site. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

put.summary: Update enabled state of analytics extensions on site
put.description: Enables or disables analytics extensions on a site. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators. Availability - This method is not available for Tableau Online.

get.summary: List dashboard extension settings of site
get.description: Lists the dashboard extension settings of the site you are signed into. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

put.summary: Update dashboard extension settings of site
put.description: Updates the settings for dashboard extensions for the site you are signed into. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

get.summary: List blocked dashboard extensions on server
get.description: Lists the dashboard extensions on the blocked list of a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators. Availability - Not available for Tableau Online.

post.description: Adds a dashboard extension to the block list of a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators. Availability - Not available for Tableau Online.

get.summary: Lists allowed dashboard extensions on site
get.description: Lists the dashboard extensions on the safe list of the site you are signed into. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

post.description: Adds a dashboard extension to the safe list the site you are signed into. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators. Availability - Not available for Tableau Online.

get.summary: List analytics extension connections on site
get.description: Lists a site's analytics extension connections for external services. Permissions- This method can be called by site and server administrators.

post.summary: Add analytics extension connection to site
post.description: Adds a connection to an external service for analytics extensions on this site. Permissions - This method can be called by site and server administrators.

get.summary: Get enabled state of analytics extensions on server
get.description: Gets the enabled/disabled state of analytics extensions on a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators.

put.description: Enables or disables analytics extensions on a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators.

get.summary: Get blocked dashboard extension on server
get.description: Gets the details of a specific dashboard extension on the blocked list of a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators. Availability - Not available for Tableau Online.

delete.description: Deletes a specific extension from the block list of a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators. Availability - Not available for Tableau Online.

get.summary: List dashboard extension settings of server
get.description: Lists the dashboard extension settings of a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators. Availability - Not available for Tableau Online.

put.summary: Update dashboard extensions settings of server
put.description: Updates the settings for dashboard extensions of a server. Permissions - This method can only be called by server administrators.

MissingAuth.description:
Missing credentials. 
The user could not be authenticated because the credentials token is missing from the request. Use the token from the response to a successful sign in request.

InvalidAuth.description:
Invalid credentials. 
The user could not be authenticated because the credentials token in the request is invalid. Use the token from the response to a successful sign in request.

ServerAdminRequired.description: Server  permissions are required for this request.

ServerOrSiteAdminRequired.description: Server or site administrator permissions are required for this request.

AnalyticsExtensionsDisabledOnServer.description: Analytics extensions are disabled on the server and cannot be enabled on this site.

MultipleConnectionsAttempted.description: A connection is already configured for this site. Only one connection per site is currently supported.

InvalidConnectionType.description: The connection type is not valid. Specify "TABPY" or "RSERVE".

InvalidConnectionHostName.description: The host name of the connection not valid.

InvalidConnectionPort.description: The port number of the connection is not valid or is missing.

InvalidConnectionUsername.description: The username of the connection is not valid.

InvalidConnectionPassword.description: The password of the connection is not an allowed value.

InvalidConnectionSSLSettings.description: The SSL settings of the site and HTTP/HTTPS prefix of the hostname do not match.

SafeListItemNonexistent.description: Unable to find a safe list item with given LUID.

BlockListItemNonexistent.description: Unable to find a block list item with given LUID.

host.description: Required. The location of an external service (TabPy, Rserve, EINSTEIN_DISCOVERY, Generic API, or other) that responds to your analytics extension requests. The case sensitive value must be a URI, IPv4 or IPv6 address that is a maximum of 255 Unicode characters.

is_auth_enabled.description:
For Tableau Online: The value is always true. 
 
 For on premise Tableau servers:  Optional. Set to true if authentication is enabled on the external service. If  true, username and password are required. Default is false.

username.description: For Tableau Online: A username is always required.

password.description: For Tableau Online: A password is always required.

is_ssl_enabled.description:
For Tableau Online: The value is always true. 
 
 For on premise Tableau servers:  Optional. Set to true if authentication is enabled on the external service. If  true, username and password are required. Default is false.

extensions_enabled.description: Specifies whether sandboxed extensions are allowed to run on the site.

tableau.extensions.dashboard.v1.ServerSe.description: Extension settings of a Tableau server.

items.description: List of connections to external services available for analytics extensions on a site.

tableau.extensions.dashboard.v1.BlockLis.description: List of dashboard extensions blocked from running on a server.

extensions_enabled.description: Specifies whether extensions are allowed to run on the site.

allow_sandboxed.description: Specifies whether sandboxed extensions are allowed to run on the site.

tableau.extensions.dashboard.v1.SiteSett.description: Dashboard extension settings of a site.

tableau.extensions.dashboard.v1.SafeList.description: A list of dashboard extensions allowed to run on a site.

items.description: List of basic connection details, including connection type and name, for each analytics extension connection available on a site.

url.description: Location of the dashboard extension to be blocked from a site.

tableau.extensions.dashboard.v1.BlockLis.description: A dashboard extension that is blocked from running on a server.

url.description: Location of the dashboard extension to be allowed on a site.

allow_full_data.description: When true, the extension has access to underlying data of a workbook. This setting is only effective when the extension is on the site safe list. Default is false.

prompt_needed.description: When true, the user will be prompted to grant an extension access to the underlying data of a workbook. This setting is only effective when the extension is on the site safe list. Default is false.

tableau.extensions.dashboard.v1.SafeList.description: A dashboard extension that is allowed to run on a site.

connection_name.description: Required. The title of the connection.

connection_type.description: Required. The kind of service responding to analytics extension requests. The value can be: TABPY, for a [Tableau TabPy](https://github.com/tableau/TabPy) server; GENERIC_API for your custom service that complies with the [Analytics Extensions API spec](https://tableau.github.io/analytics-extensions-api/docs/ae_intro.html); or RSERVE, for an [Rserve](https://www.tableau.com/solutions/r) service; or EINSTEIN_DISCOVERY for your instance of [Einstein Discovery](https://help.tableau.com/current/server-linux/en-us/config_r_tabpy.htm).

tableau.auth.header.name: X-Tableau-Auth
tableau.auth.header.description:
The Tableau authentication header. The value is a credentials token from a Tableau server's response to an authentication request. 

 The Content-Type and Accept headers should be the mediatype of the request and response except in cases where you want to  [explicitly allow other versions of the resource](https://help.tableau.com/current/api/rest_api/en-us/REST/rest_api_concepts_versions.htm#per_resource_versioning).
